Name: 3 Wholesome Mystery Series You’ll Find at Ignatius Book Fairs
Post Body:
Discover three wholesome mystery series waiting for you at Ignatius Book Fairs! With each book carefully curated for moral and enriching content, Ignatius Book Fairs ensures a safe and uplifting reading experience for families. Explore our collection today and discover mysteries that inspire and foster a love for faith-filled adventures. Check out these and many other wholesome books at the next Ignatius Book Fair or at shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com!

Theodore Boone Series by John Grisham | A Book Fair Team Favorite!

1st Book—Theodore Boone: Kid Lawyer

John Grisham’s first book in the Theodore Boone series introduces readers to Theo, a 13-year-old who dreams of being a high stakes trial lawyer. While hanging around his parents’ law firm, Theo learns the details of a recent case involving a murder in his small town. With the help of his friends, Theo does a bit of his own investigating, uncovering some valuable information to help crack the case. This series is perfect for young readers who love suspense, written by one of the most credible mystery authors in the business.  

Book Fair Tip: If you enjoy Theodore Boone: Kid Lawyer, check out the second book in the series; Theodore Boone: The Abduction, at the next Ignatius Book Fair!

Encyclopedia Brown Series by Donold J. Sobol | An Safe and Interactive Series for Young Readers

1st Book—Encyclopedia Brown: Boy Detective

Leroy Brown, more commonly known as “Encyclopedia” Brown, works as a detective, charging 25 cents for each mystery he solves. Kids come to Encyclopedia Brown from all over, asking him to use his knowledge to ensure justice is served. Each book provides readers with 10 mysteries that they are encouraged to solve with Encyclopedia Brown! The answers to each short mystery are given at the end of the book so children can check their answers with Encyclopedia's. The Encyclopedia Brown series, for children seven and up, is a fun way to get their brains working and practice their detective skills! Make sure to look for the box set at the next Ignatius Book Fair!

Father Gabriel Mystery Series by Fiorella De Maria | A Gripping Series with a Catholic Twist!

1st Book—The Sleeping Witness

The first book in the Father Gabriel Mystery series, The Sleeping Witness, brings readers to St. Mary’s Abbey in England, where a brutal crime has been committed. There has been a murder on the Abbey’s grounds, and everyone believes Dr. Paige to be the primary suspect. However, Fr. Gabriel, a Benedictine priest, remains unconvinced and takes it upon himself to uncover the truth. Set in post-war England, Fr. Gabriel’s journey takes readers on a suspenseful adventure, working to solve the tranquil Abbey’s heinous crime. These engaging mysteries combine faith and suspense into a series you won’t want to put down! The series continues as Father Gabriel solves another mystery in The Vanishing Woman.

Check out this series and many other captivating reads at the next Ignatius Book Fair or at shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com. You can be sure that every book at an Ignatius Book Fair has been carefully vetted to ensure that your children receive the best possible content, providing them with virtuous role models and enriching storylines. See you at the Book Fair!

‍
Post Summary: Discover 3 wholesome mystery series waiting for you at Ignatius Book Fairs! With each mystery carefully curated for moral and enriching content, Ignatius Book Fairs ensures a safe and uplifting reading experience for families. Explore our collection today and discover mysteries that truly inspire!

Name: 5 Books from Ignatius Book Fairs to Read with Your Kids This Lent
Post Body:
Lent is a time to prepare ourselves for the death of Jesus Christ on Good Friday and his glorious Resurrection at Easter. Reading, especially with your children, is a beautiful way to participate in this season of preparation!  

Discover wholesome and enriching literature at Ignatius Book Fairs, with books designed to enhance your family's faith journey. Explore hundreds of inspiring tales and timeless lessons, carefully curated to deepen your child's spiritual understanding during this sacred season. Below are five books to read with your children this Lent:

‍

The Life of Jesus—According to St. Luke | A New Catholic Title from Ignatius Book Fairs (Ages 7 and up)

This amazing book by Magnificat and Ignatius Press gives children an easy-to-read translation of the life of Jesus based on Luke’s Gospel. The captivating illustrations make this book a family favorite and one your child is sure to enjoy. Along with extensive commentary on the Gospel, The Life of Jesus—According to St. Luke provides additional descriptions of events, such as the Jewish Passover, to aid in your child’s understanding of the Lenten season. Keep your eye out for this title at the next Ignatius Book Fair or shop online at shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com.

‍

The Illustrated Miracles of Jesus for Children | A Kid-Friendly Book Fair Favorite (Age 4 and up)

We have discovered that younger readers love Ignatius Book Fairs for the wide variety of engaging illustrations. If you’re looking for a book for younger children, check out Jean-Francois Kieffer’s The Illustrated Miracles of Jesus for Children. This comic-style book follows the many miracles Jesus performs in his lifetime, from the Wedding at Cana to the Raising of Lazarus! The bright illustrations and unique style make this book a fun and engaging read with your little ones this Lent.

Book Fair Tip: Check out more illustrated books by Jean-Francois Kieffer at the next Ignatius Book Fair, such as The Adventures of Loupio!  

Trouble with Lent | A Catholic Lenten Favorite (Age 6 and up)

For a fictional novel to read this Lent, look for Trouble with Lent at the Book Fair! This book, focused on sacrifice and overcoming temptation, is the fourth in The Adventures of Nick and Sam series. Published by the Augustine Institute, Trouble with Lent follows the Lenten journey of eight-year-old twins Nicholas and Samantha as they work through the challenges of friendship and showing the love of Christ to others. This book helps children understand the meaning of the Catholic liturgical calendar and provides an example of how the season of Lent prepares us for the joy of Easter!  

The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe | A Christian Classic (Age 7 and up)

This wholesome classic has been a staple on bookshelves for the last 70 years! The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe is also the perfect Lenten book as it details the sacrifice of the Great Lion, Aslan. Following the adventures of Peter, Edmund, Susan, and Lucy in the land of Narnia, this novel contrasts the enslaving nature of sin with freedom of sacrificial love. The Christ-like figure of Aslan prepares readers for the sacrifice of Jesus on Good Friday and his Resurrection on Easter Sunday.  

As the second book in the Chronicles of Narnia series, The Lion, The Witch, and The Wardrobe has inspired countless readers over the last seven decades, and it is sure to captivate your child as well. For more wholesome fiction with a Christian twist visit the next Ignatius Book Fair!

The Illustrated Bible for Children—Comic Style | Find the Perfect Bible at Ignatius Book Fairs (ages 7 and up)

Introducing a comic book that brings the Bible to life! With easy-to-read commentary on events from Genesis to the Acts of the Apostles, The Illustrated Bible for Children is a fun and engaging way to teach your little ones about salvation history. Work through the Bible with your child this Lent, beginning with the creation of the world, through the Resurrection of Christ, and ending with Paul’s journey to Rome. This book is a wonderful introduction to the Catholic faith and a great way to get your child excited about the Lenten season!

See You at The Book Fair!

Check out these faith-filled books and many other captivating reads at the next Ignatius Book Fair or at shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com. You can be sure that every book at an Ignatius Book Fair has been carefully curated to ensure that your children receive the best possible content, providing them with virtuous role models and enriching storylines. May God bless you and your family this Lent!

‍

Name: 7 Daily Quotes to Deepen Your Faith this Week (March 9-16)
Post Body:
Enjoy these quotes from our amazing and wholesome books this Lent! Be sure to visit shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com for more inspiring titles from the Ignatius Book Fair.

Mar. 9

“I love going to Mass! The more we receive Jesus in the Eucharist, the more we will become like him. . . . Can you not see the beauty hidden in the Mass? Digital Disciple: Carlo Acutis and the Eucharist

‍

Mar. 10

“The greatest wealth is to know how to give. Don’t forget that.” The Adventures of Loupio Vol. 1

‍

Mar. 11

"'I am [in your world].’ said Aslan. ‘But there I have another name. You must learn to know me by that name. This was the very reason why you were brought to Narnia, that by knowing me here for a little, you may know me better there.'" Voyage of the Dawn Treader: The Chronicles of Narnia

‍

Mar. 12

“The answer came, loud and clear: ‘Believe me, before Abraham came to be, I AM.’ There was a sudden hush, all breath suspended.” The Spear

‍

Mar. 13

“We know that God is everywhere; but certainly we feel His presence most when His works are on the grandest scale spread before us; and it is in the unclouded night-sky, where His worlds wheel their silent course, that we read clearest His infinitude, His omnipotence, His omnipresence.” Jane Eyre

‍

Mar. 14

“As soon as the Lady appeared, Bernadette asked her the same question: ‘Could you tell me your name please?’ And this time the Lady answered! She spread out her hands toward the ground as though in prayer and said in the native local dialect, ‘I am the Immaculate Conception!’” Bernadette: The Little Girl from Lourdes

‍

Mar. 15

“Vanity and pride are different things, though the words are often used synonymously. A person may be proud without being vain. Pride relates more to our opinion of ourselves, vanity to what we would have others think of us.” Pride and Prejudice

‍

Mar. 16

“O God, come to my aid!” Hugh O’Flaherty: Irish Priest Who Resisted the Nazis

‍

Interested in hosting an Ignatius Book Fair? Fill out an inquiry form at ignatiusbookfairs.com!

‍
Post Summary: Enjoy these quotes from our amazing and wholesome books this Lent! Be sure to visit shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com for more inspiring titles from the Catholic Book Fair.

Name: Building a Catholic Library: 6 Essential Titles for Every School and Home
Post Body:
If you are looking for Catholic titles to fill your home or school library, look no further than Ignatius Book Fairs! These six titles are must-haves in any Catholic collection. With books for every audience, you are sure to find everything you're looking for at the Ignatius Book Fair!

‍

    1. Francis: The Poor Man of Assisi by Juliette Levivier | A Beloved Catholic Saint

Francis: The Poor Man of Assisi by Juliette Levivier is a compelling biography about the life and legacy of St. Francis of Assisi. Levivier skillfully tells the story of St. Francis, tracing his transformation from a privileged young man to a humble servant of God. Through vivid storytelling, the book explores Francis' radical commitment to poverty, his deep love for nature and animals, and his enduring impact on Christianity. Francis: The Poor Man of Assisi is a captivating portrayal of a saint whose life continues to inspire and challenge readers to live lives of faith and service.

‍

‍

  1. A Missal for Toddlers by Magnificat | The Perfect Mass Companion

This simple and durable illustrated missal allows a young child to follow the prayers and actions of the Holy Mass step by step! This book shows children how to act during Mass and details the parts of the Mass in easy-to-understand descriptions. A Missal for Toddlers is a great way to expose kids to the essence of the Holy Mass.

‍

‍

  1. A Catholic Child’s Illustrated Lives of the Saints by L.E. McCullough | A Book Fair Favorite!

A Catholic Child’s Illustrated Lives of the Saints is a beautifully curated book that introduces young readers to the inspiring lives of over 65 saints! The book is thoughtfully arranged by each saint’s feast day, making it engaging and educational for children throughout the year. Each saint is accompanied by a beautiful image, short biography, and a prayer asking for their powerful intercession. Look for A Catholic Child’s Illustrated Lives of the Saints at the next Ignatius Book Fair and enjoy learning about the many saints of the Church alongside your children!

‍

  1. The Spear by Louis de Wohl | The Crucifixion from a Different Perspective

The Spear by Louis de Wohl is a historical novel centered around the events leading up to the Crucifixion of Jesus Christ. Set in Jerusalem, the novel follows the journey of Longinus, a Roman centurion tasked with overseeing the Crucifixion. As he witnesses the events surrounding Jesus' death, Longinus experiences a profound spiritual transformation. The novel weaves together elements of historical fiction, biblical narrative, and spiritual exploration, offering readers a vivid portrayal of the Crucifixion of Jesus Christ. Through Longinus' perspective, the novel explores themes of faith, redemption, and the power of forgiveness. This book is perfect for older teens and adults!

‍

  1. The Great Divorce by C.S. Lewis | A Wholesome Must-Read!

The Great Divorce by C.S. Lewis explores themes of heaven, hell, and human nature. The story follows a group of souls who take a ride from hell to the outskirts of heaven, where they are given the opportunity to either stay in heaven or return to hell. Through encounters with various celestial beings and conversations with the inhabitants of heaven, the characters grapple with their own flaws, fears, and desires. Lewis uses the fantastical setting to explore theological concepts, offering insights into the nature of sin, redemption, and the choices that shape our eternal destiny.

‍

  1. The Little Way: A Journey to the Summit of Love by Judith Bouilloc & Sara Ugolotti | Theological Lessons for Young Children

The Little Way: A Journey to the Summit of Love by Judith Bouilloc and Sara Ugolotti is a spiritual guide inspired by the life and teachings of St. Thérèse of Lisieux, also known as the Little Flower. The book explores the concept of the "Little Way," a path of spiritual growth and holiness through simple acts of love and devotion in everyday life. Drawing from Thérèse's own writings and experiences, the authors offer practical insights and reflections to help readers deepen their faith and cultivate a closer relationship with God. Through stories, prayers, and reflections, "The Little Way" invites readers to embrace humility, trust, and childlike faith as they journey toward the summit of divine love.

‍
Post Summary: If you are looking for Catholic titles to fill your home or school library, look no further than Ignatius Book Fairs! These six titles are must-haves in any Catholic collection. With books for every audience, you are sure to find everything you're looking for at the Ignatius Book Fair!

Name: Elevate Your Lent: 3 Catholic Picks from Ignatius Book Fairs to Deepen Your Faith
Post Body:
Elevate Your Lent with Ignatius Book Fairs! Discover three wholesome picks to deepen your faith and enrich your family's Lenten journey. As a trusted destination for Catholic literature, Ignatius Book Fairs offer a safe and enriching environment for your children to explore the richness of their faith. From captivating devotional companions to interactive catechism activities, our carefully curated selection ensures a wholesome experience for readers of all ages.

Visit an Ignatius Book Fair today to foster a deeper connection to Christ through literature that inspires and educates.

‍The Catholic All Year Prayer Companion by Kendra Tierney

Discover a beautiful companion for your faith journey at the Book Fair!

Author Kendra Tierney makes it easy to live out the Catholic faith all year long! Based on the richness of the liturgical calendar, this book is filled with powerful prayers, litanies, activities, and blessings all focused on leading you to a deeper devotion to Christ and the saints. This daily devotional is sure to keep you on track this Lent and help you gain a deeper peace in Christ. Keep your eye out for this title at the next Ignatius Book Fair!

Book Fair Tip: Be sure to also check out The Catholic All Year Compendium: Liturgical Living for Real Life by Kendra Tierney!

‍

The Power of Silence by Robert Cardinal Sarah | A Book Fair Favorite

In a world filled with distractions and noise, it's easy to feel overwhelmed. During the Lenten season, we are called to resist the world's many temptations and place our trust in the Lord. To trust Jesus requires an inner peace, a recognition that God is not found in the howling winds or the roaring fire, but in the gentle whisper of silence (1 Kings 19:11-13). Cardinal Sarah seeks to recover the beauty of silence in his book The Power of Silence. This book is a perfect choice for moms and dads visiting the Ignatius Book Fairs.

In an interview with Nicolas Diat, Cardinal Sarah rejects modern society's “dictatorship of noise,” and offers advice on how to recover peace by quieting our hearts and minds. Sarah also addresses the tough questions regarding God’s silence in the face of our sufferings and in opposition to evil. With an afterword by Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI, The Power of Silence will help you fight back against the world’s noise this Lent and regain peace in the love of Christ.  

‍

100 Activities Based on the Catechism of the Catholic Church by Ellen Rossini | A Book Fair Teacher Top Pick

This interactive book contains activities for kids in grades 1-8 based on the wisdom of the Catechism of the Catholic Church. Taking the ideas explained in the Catechism, this book provides practical worksheets, games, and more to help children understand the teachings of the Catholic Church. Activities focus on each of the four parts of the Catechism: Faith, Sacraments, Morality and Prayer. This Lent, work through the Church’s teachings with your children and open their eyes to the beauty of Christ’s message! This book is especially popular among teachers at the Ignatius Book Fairs who seek to connect the faith to the classroom.  

‍

To get your hands on these amazing reads, visit your local Ignatius Book Fair or shop online at shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com. May God bless you this Lent!
Post Summary: Discover three Catholic picks to deepen your family's Lenten journey! As a trusted destination for Catholic literature, Ignatius Book Fairs offers a safe and enriching environment for your family to explore the richness of the Catholic faith. From captivating devotional companions to interactive catechism activities, our carefully curated selection ensures a wholesome experience for readers of all ages.

Name: How to use the Ignatius Book Fairs eWallet
rt-html:
Introducing the Ignatius Book Fairs E-Wallet: the convenient way to manage and spend your book fair credits.    Purchase your e-wallet at the Ignatius Book Fairs store, assign it to one or more children, and then use it    to redeem credits at any live book fair. The person handling your order will have instant access to all your    e-wallet credits, streamlining the process and making book fair shopping a breeze.  

   
   
     

         Go to the e-wallet category on the Ignatius Book Fairs store      

     

       To add money to your child's e-wallet account, start by visiting the e-Wallet category page to view all e-wallet options.

   
   
         
 
   
   
     

Purchase an e-wallet Credit Pack

     

Add an e-wallet pack to your shopping cart. Choose either 10, 25, or 50 e-Wallet dollars.

   
   
         
 
   
   
     

Assign e-wllet Credits to a Child's Classroom

     

       On the shopping cart, choose which child will receive the e-Wallet credits. This will help Book Fair        administrators use the credits at point of sale at the book fair.      

   
   
         
 
   
   
     

View balance on your Parent Hub

     

       Parents can then go to the Parent Hub to see e-Wallet balances for each of their children.      

   
   
         
 
   
   
     

At the Fair

     

       The book fair admin will see all the eWallet balances for your school on the point of sale device.      

   
   
         
 
   
   
     

Redeeming Credits

     

       The book fair admin can then redeem any eWallet balances just like cash. Once used, the new eWallet        balance will be instantly reflected on the Ignatius Book Fair store Parent Hub.

Name: Ignatius Book Fair Features: 7 Inspiring History Titles at Ignatius Book Fairs
Post Body:
Ignatius Book Fairs provide young history enthusiasts with wholesome and captivating historical fiction novels. From the glory of Ancient Rome to the trials of World War II, these books allow readers to experience pivotal moments in world history!

Ignatius Book Fairs’ curated selection of titles offers suitable content for all ages, providing a nurturing environment for kids to discover safe and enriching literature. Explore these seven wholesome reads at the next Ignatius Book Fair or online at shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com!

‍

Fly Boy by Eric Walters | An Ignatius Book Fair Favorite!

‍

Fly Boy tells the captivating story of Robbie McWilliams, a Canadian 17-year-old who wishes to follow his father by enlisting in the Royal Canadian Air Force. Living amid WWII, Robbie will do anything to join the Air Force, even seeking a way around the minimum age requirement set by the Canadian military. Once he has snuck into the Air Force, Robbie travels to Europe to join the Allied powers in their effort against Nazi Germany.  

Perfect for middle schoolers, Fly Boy takes young readers through the skies of Europe, accompanying Robbie and his companions on numerous missions. Author Eric Walters teaches his audience important lessons in leadership, forgiveness, and bravery in this engaging and inspiring story. Embark on this inspirational journey with Robbie McWilliams at the next Ignatius Book Fair!

‍

Medal of Honor- Ryan Pitts by Michael P. Spradlin | A Book Fair Beloved Series

‍

Inspire your children with the Medal of Honor Series! This historical fiction series sheds light on the heroic actions of United States' service members who have earned the country’s highest military award: The Medal of Honor. In the second volume of the series, author Michael Spradlin shares the story of Ryan Pitts, an army sergeant who valiantly fought in the Battle of Wanat in Afgahanistan. In addition to commentary on the brave acts of Sgt. Pitts and his comrades, Spradlin’s biography provides battle maps, photographs, and other visual statistics to enhance your young reader’s understanding. Be sure to check out the rest of the series at the next Book Fair!

‍

A Most Dangerous Innocence by Fiorella De Maria | A New Narrative from Ignatius Book Fairs

‍

Fiorella De Maria’s historical fiction novel A Most Dangerous Innocence introduces readers to Judy Randall, a school-age girl struggling with autism. Her story takes place in 1940, during Britain’s lonely stand against Nazi forces, following the surrender of France. Struggling to connect with her schoolteachers and peers, Judy attempts to convince others of the true identity of her headmistress, whom she believes is an undercover Nazi. Seeking to prove her theory, Judy gets herself into trouble, further frustrating her teachers. Filled with suspense, A Most Dangerous Innocence is sure to captivate readers who seek a historical thriller with a likeable, yet unorthodox protagonist.

‍

Johnny Tremain by Ester Forbes | A Wholesome Classic

‍

Johnny Tremain, a renowned Newberry Medal-winning novel, follows the story of a young American at the time of the Revolutionary War. Set in Boston, young Johnny finds himself in the company of Sam Adams, Paul Revere, and other American patriots as he participates in historical events, such as the Boston Tea Party. Esther Forbes’ captivating and wholesome story has inspired young readers since its publication in 1943, teaching children the importance of standing up for their beliefs. Enjoy the inspirational story of Johnny Tremain and other historical heroes at an Ignatius Book Fair near you!

‍

The Shadow of His Wings: A Graphic Biography of Fr. Gereon Goldmann by Max Temesou | A Catholic Comic!

‍

This historical comic book follows the life of Fr. Gereon Goldmann, a young German seminarian who desires to become a Catholic priest. Enlisted into the German army in WWII, Goldmann takes it upon himself to care for the spiritual needs of the German soldiers. His adventures take him across the globe, proclaiming Christ’s message amid war and death. Engaging illustrations bring this inspiring story to life, serving as a perfect choice for young readers. Fr. Goldmann’s biography gives children an example of deep faith, courage, and leadership, teaching children how to stand firm in the face of opposition and fear. Fr. Goldmann’s story has become a fan favorite among Ignatius Book Fair’s team of curators who carefully read every book!


In the Shadows of Rome Series by Sophie de Mullenhiem | A Top Christian Series at Ignatius Book Fairs

‍

The new series, In the Shadows of Rome, follows four friends who live during the Roman persecution of early Christians. The first novel in the series, The Phantom of the Colosseum, introduces readers to the characters Blandula, Maximus, Titus, and Aghlies. These characters, having grown up worshiping the Roman gods, slowly learn about a new religion influencing their friends and wreaking havoc in Rome. The fast-paced writing style and intriguing adventures keep young readers engaged and on the edge of their seats! The Phantom of the Colosseum introduces children to the history of the early Church and the valiant heroes of the Roman persecutions. Author Sophie de Mullenhiem perfectly blends history and faith into one epic series of intrigue and bravery.

‍

Book Fair Tip: After this, check out the second book in the series: A Lion for the Emperor!
‍
All The Light We Cannot See by Anthony Doerr | A Book Fair Award Winner!

‍

For advanced readers, check out the winner of the 2015 Pulitzer Prize for fiction: All the Light We Cannot See. This WWII novel follows the converging stories of Marie-Laure, a blind French girl, and Werner Pfennig, a young German orphan. During the war, Marie-Laure and her father escape Paris and take refuge in Saint-Malo, a coastal town in Northern France. They bring with them a valuable diamond, which her father attempts to hide from the German authorities. Werner, whose father died in a coal mine, does all he can to escape the same fate, even if that means enrolling in a Hitler Youth Academy. Working to advance German technology, Werner’s path collides with Marie-Laure's in Saint-Malo, changing the lives of both children. This 531-page novel is filled with beautiful prose and descriptive imagery, to share the captivating story of two children living amid the destruction of the Second World War. Pick up All the Light We Cannot See at the next Ignatius Book Fair or online at shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com!  

‍

These seven books, carefully chosen and vetted for content by our Book Fair team, transport readers into some of the most inspirational moments in history, following faithful characters as they embark on thrilling journeys. Check out more wholesome historical fiction at your next catholic book fair or online at shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com

‍
Post Summary: Ignatius Book Fairs provide young history enthusiasts with wholesome and captivating historical fiction novels. From the glory of Ancient Rome to the trials of World War II, these books connect children to pivotal moments in world history! Here are 7 titles to look for at your next Ignatius Book Fair.

Name: Ignatius Book Fairs Featured on the Son Rise Morning Show!
Post Body:
Ignatius Book Fairs Featured on the Son Rise Morning Show!

‍

Ignatius Book Fairs was recently featured on Sacred Heart Radio's Son Rise Morning Show! On the April 3 episode, host Anna Mitchell interviewed Rose Trabbic, director of Operations at Ignatius Book Fairs. On the show, the two discussed the need for a Catholic book fair and the selection process for wholesome books!

‍

The Need for Catholic Book Fairs! | “Ignatius Press with Ave Maria University Are Filling That Void”

Rose and Anna began by discussing the book fair landscape and the need for an authentically Catholic fair. Rose explained that after many requests from Catholic schools, Ignatius Book Fairs finally gives these schools a wholesome and faith-filled alternative to mainstream book fairs. In response to the large demand, Ignatius Book Fairs are expanding all throughout the continental United States, and fairs are now taking place from coast to coast!  

Want to know where the fairs are taking place? Visit ignatiusbookfairs.com for a constantly updated map!

‍

How Does Ignatius Book Fairs Select Their Books?

Later in the segment, Anna asked Rose about Ignatius Book Fairs' selection process for literature. Rose explained that each book has been read for content before they land on the shelves, to ensure that every title is “edifying and nourishing” for children. At Ignatius Book Fairs, schools can expect 30% of titles to be explicitly Catholic and the remaining 70% to be enriching, non-religious books that feature positive role models and uplifting storylines.

“[At Ignatius Book Fairs, we] select books that will bring beauty, truth and goodness in the lives of children” — Rose Trabbic, IBF Director of Operations

‍

What Qualifies a “Good” Book? | Inside the Curation Process

Rose, then, detailed Ignatius Book Fairs' “curation” process. She explained that for Ignatius Book Fairs to feature a book, it must tell a good story, as well as have beautiful art and content that inspires and captivates children. These featured titles range from classic novels to fictional stories, from arts and craft books to mystery thrillers!  

Parents can have peace of mind knowing that nothing offered by Ignatius Book Fairs contains material contrary to the Catholic faith or traditional Christian morals.

“That’s our promise to parents, that anything that you find at an Ignatius Book Fair will be something that you can trust” — Rose Trabbic

‍

How Does Your School Host an Ignatius Book Fair? | The Next Step!

What is the next step? Have your school fill out an online inquiry form at ignatiusbookfairs.com! Once completed, an Ignatius Book Fair Pro will reach out to learn more about your school.

If you’re a parent, you can get involved too! There are printable resources on the Ignatius Book Fairs website that you can bring to your school. Rose encouraged parents to schedule meetings with their school’s principal or librarian about hosting an Ignatius Book Fair.

‍

How do the Fairs Work? | Dates and Titles

Rose noted that each in-person book fair lasts for five days, with one of the days opened to parishes and parents. The Fairs are primarily directed at K-8 students, with optional packages for high school and young adults. Each title is shipped to schools anywhere in the continental United States. For any other questions, Rose directed listeners to the Frequently Asked Questions page on the Ignatius Book Fairs website.  

‍
Post Summary: Ignatius Book Fairs was recently featured on Sacred Heart Radio's Son Rise Morning Show! On the April 3rd episode, host Anna Mitchell interviewed Rose Trabbic, director of Operations at Ignatius Book Fairs. On the show, the two discussed the need for a Catholic Book Fair and the selection process for wholesome books!

Name: Ignatius Book Fairs Origin Story
Post Body:
The Beginnings  

In 1978, Father Joseph D. Fessio, S.J., together with Carolyn Lemon, founded a small publishing house to make the works of great 20th century European theologians available in English. These luminaries included such figures as Joseph Ratzinger, Hans Urs von Balthasar, Henri de Lubac, Louis Bouyer, and Adrienne von Speyr, and in the decades since, the Ignatius Press catalog has come to include hundreds of authors and thousands of titles. Ave Maria University came to follow in the year 2003 with Fr. Fessio as the founding provost.  

President Mark Middendorf was selected as the fourth president of Ave Maria University, beginning February 1, 2022. Before taking this role, Mark left the corporate world founding a lay apostolate, Lighthouse Catholic Media. From its beginning on August 15, 2005, to its merger with the Augustine Institute on December 8, 2015, Lighthouse grew to become the largest producer of Catholic audio talks in the world, reaching over 17 million souls with its life-changing presentations on the Gospel of Jesus Christ. Together with its partner Ignatius Press, the Augustine Institute provides resources for evangelization and catechesis to more than 6,500 parishes and well over 1 million users.  

“I’ve worked for a long time in the world of evangelization, of forming people, and I have seen how effective Ignatius Press has been in forming people from the five previous partnerships I have had with them through the Augustine Institute. For example, IP and AI partnered on “Word of Life,” which was a program that offered an entire curriculum aimed at the formation of the youth in schools.

"Through the partnership of the Book Fair, Ave Maria University and Ignatius Press are going to bring that same formation to bear on students who will receive help in forming their intellects in the love of truth, their will in the love of God, and their hearts.”

- AMU President Mark Middendorf

Answering the Call 

Deciding to take on this responsibility of serving the youth through the promotion of inspiring and educational literature of both Christian and non-religious material in order to better form the minds of children and cultivate community, Ignatius Book Fairs came to life.

The start of this book fair may have taken eight years to move from word of mouth to pen and paper, but the Book Fair team is excited to respond to this call of inspiring and educating the youth. No success story is without challenges, but this team of student interns, faculty and board members are well prepared to face the hurdles that will come along the way because of their unwavering faith in this mission, seeing these challenges as opportunities to reach more souls!

With the birth of Ignatius Book Fairs, through the partnership of Ignatius Press and Ave Maria University and God’s Divine Providence, we are ready to roll out book fairs!
Post Summary: The start of this book fair may have taken eight years to move from word of mouth to pen and paper, but the Book Fair team is excited to respond to this call of inspiring and educating the youth. No success story is without challenges, but this team of student interns, faculty and board members are well prepared to face the hurdles that will come along the way because of their unwavering faith in this mission, seeing these challenges as opportunities to reach more souls!

Name: Ignatius Book Fairs Presents: Inspiring Catholic Saints for Your Child’s Life
Post Body:
The Catholic Church provides the faithful with many gifts and opportunities to grow closer to God. Among these gifts is the communion of saints who are witnesses to Christ through their lives and stories. Families seeking to grow closer to Christ will find the following Catholic saints helpful and inspiring for their journey to Heaven. Check out these powerful and wholesome saint stories for your children at the next Ignatius Book Fair!

‍

Saint John Bosco and Dominic Savio | Youthful Witnesses to the Catholic Faith

If you're looking for a Catholic saint to inspire your children, there is no one better than St. John Bosco! Serving as an apostle to the youth, St. John Bosco opened several schools and brought many children to the faith by encouraging them in prayer and closer communion with God. St. John Bosco was also known for his great sense of humor!

One of his students, St. Dominic Savio, died at 14 years old and was later canonized in 1954. His desire to become a saint led him to do "ordinary things in an extraordinary way." In Saint John Bosco and Dominic Savio by Catherine Beebe, children will enjoy reading about a saint as old as them! At the next Ignatius Book Fair, keep your eye out for this beautiful and faithful story of two inspirational Catholic saints!

‍

St. Thérèse the Little Flower | A Catholic Child with a Big Message

Learn more about St. Thérèse of Lisieux, the beloved French saint, at the Ignatius Book Fair! Affectionately known as “The Little Flower,” St. Thérèse joined the Carmelite sisters as a teenager. Her “Little Way” of living teaches important truths about humility, meekness, and complete dependence on God. Raised in a devout family, Thérèse grew up with four older sisters; each of whom also joined the religious life. Her parents, Zelie and Louis Martin are also known for their holiness and recognized as saints!  

Saint Thérèse and the Roses by Helen Walker Homan describes the humble life of St. Thérèse and her devotion to the Child Jesus. Thérèse's humility and child-like faith make her the perfect saint for your family to learn more about!

‍

Ignatius Book Fair Tip: Interested in more about St. Thérèse of Lisieux? Look for The Little Way: A Journey to the Summit of Love at the next Ignatius Book Fair!

‍

St. Bernadette | Ignatius Book Fairs Saint of the Month!  

In 1858, Our Lady of Lourdes appeared to little Bernadette, speaking with her and performing miracles of spiritual and physical healing. At Lourdes, Our Lady revealed herself as “the Immaculate Conception,” a term young Bernadette had never heard before. To this day, thousands of people gather at the apparition sight in southern France to touch the waters and pray for miracles—and the miracles have continued to occur!

Children can read about the story of St. Bernadette in Bernadette: Our Lady’s Little Servant by Hertha Pauli. Her story is a testimony to the miraculous power of trust in the Lord and sweet simplicity. Learn more about Our Lady of Lourdes and St. Bernadette at the Ignatius Book Fair or online at shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com.

‍
Post Summary: Families seeking to grow closer to Christ will find the following Catholic saints helpful and inspiring for their journey to Heaven. Check out these powerful and wholesome saint stories for your children at the next Ignatius Book Fair!

Name: Ignatius Book Fairs: A Catholic Guide to Advent
Post Body:
Advent is Almost here!  

Here are 3 impactful ways for your family to make the most out of this liturgical season with beautiful Catholic books for kids.

1. Create your own Christmas Book Basket!

A wonderful tradition to begin in the family is a “Christmas Book Basket.”  

Join thousands of other Catholic families by building a basket for all your family’s Christmas and Advent books. Keep them packed away in a special box for most of the year – pull the box out on the first Sunday of Advent and arrange them in a lovely basket. Put them away on the feast of the Epiphany, January 6th and start the tradition of looking forward to these books each year!

Select beautiful new Advent and Christmas books to give as Christmas gifts and then add to your selection to continue building your basket every year!

Here are some of our top recommendations for Advent and Christmas books to start or add to your Christmas Book Basket, all available on the Ignatius Book Fairs store.

We recommend ordering by November 12th to ensure your books arrive in time for the first Sunday of Advent on December 1st.

‍

2. St. Nicholas Day Book Tradition!

‍

‍

Kick off the beginning of Advent in a fun and festive way, celebrating the Feast of St. Nicholas! On December 6, have your children set out a pair of shoes for “St. Nicholas” to fill with Advent and Catholic-themed toys and trinkets, oranges, chocolate gold coins, and Christmas or Advent themed books (which can later be added to your Christmas Book Basket). Check out The Miracle of St. Nicholas to teach your children more about the generous Bishop!

‍

Here is an example of the St. Nicholas Book Tradition:  

‍

 

3. Create or buy an Advent Wreath

‍

‍

Create or purchase an Advent wreath to use with your family and teach your children about Hope, Peace, Joy, and Love. Light the candle for each week of Advent and gather together to recite Advent prayers as a family.

Learn more about this and other Advent traditions in All About Advent and Christmas, a beautifully illustrated, full-color book perfect for Catholic families!

-----

Shop Ignatius Book Fairs for faith-filled books you can trust, each professionally curated by a team of teachers, Moms, and book publishers. Ignatius Book Fairs is the trusted alternative to national book fairs, offering carefully selected content that aligns with Catholic values for schools, parishes, and families. And every purchase benefits your school!

‍

‍
Post Summary: Advent is Almost here! Here are 3 impactful ways for your family to make the most out of this liturgical season with beautiful Catholic books for kids.

Name: Ignatius Book Fairs: A Trusted Book Fair Alternative
Post Body:
Ignatius Book Fair: A Trusted Alternative to National Book Fairs

‍

A Wholesome Book Fair Alternative

Ignatius Book Fairs offers a trustworthy solution to schools seeking a kid-friendly Book Fair experience. While Scholastic and other national companies have dominated the Book Fair market for years, many schools are seeking an alternative they can trust.

‍

As Ignatius Book Fairs are taking place across the nation, principals and librarians are sharing their experiences with Ignatius Book Fairs. Let's take a look at some of their reviews!

‍

The Need for an Alternative Book Fair  

Many voiced concerns regarding the content of mainstream book fairs in recent years. Sarah D, a librarian in Louisiana, shared, “our biggest problems we encountered with our previous book fairs was content.” Many others shared this concern.

‍

“In the past, we found that inappropriate books were coming in with the book fair company that we were using, and it was taking myself, the committee, and administration a lot of time to go through and vet the books and make sure the books align with our Catholic values. That was the biggest reason we looked for a switch.” - Jessica M.

‍

Principal Ted L. described the inappropriate content that he found in his previous book fair; “we found books pertaining to demonic possession, symbolism from the occult, books that focused on murder.” He found that these books were negatively influencing his students while also contradicting the Catholic education his school offered.

‍

Ignatius Book Fairs: The Preferred Alternative to Scholastic and Other National Book Fairs

With content issues mounting, these principals and librarians switched to Ignatius Book Fairs and have experienced profound effects. Principal Ted L. noted, “no longer do we have to worry about those other books that were really starting to cause social and emotional stress on our students. To see the outcome has been quite beautiful.”

‍

“I would refer anyone to Ignatius Book Fairs, more than anything for the quality of content.” - Sarah D, Librarian

‍

This quality extends to every title, which has been read and vetted for content by Ignatius’ team of book examiners.

‍

What Can You Expect from Ignatius’ Catholic Book Fair?

In partnering with Ignatius Book Fairs, teachers and schools can expect quality content and exceptional customer service.

‍

Christopher G, headmaster of an Illinois catholic school shared, “the thing that really jumped out to us...was the balance. There was a good ratio between outwardly religious material, especially the beautifully illustrated stories of the saints, but also just traditional classic literature, that any American regardless of religious background would find edifying.”

‍

“Ignatius had a lot of these classics that we found in the larger book fair we were using; however, they didn’t have the books we had to go through and remove.” - Ted L, Principal

‍

Schools can also expect benefits that extend beyond their in-person book fair dates. Through Ignatius’ Ave Dollars program, schools receive rewards which can be used to improve classrooms and libraries!

‍

Headmaster Christopher G shared his experience after the fair, “the Ignatius Book Fair inspired us because of the high-quality that was included to begin crafting our own school library and the rewards program through Ignatius allowed us to begin stocking that library.”

‍
‍
What’s Next for Ignatius’ Alternative Book Fair Experience?

Ignatius Book Fairs are taking place across the country. Visit one of these locations this Spring and take home a wholesome classic or a religious tale!  

To take the next step towards hosting an Ignatius Book Fair at your school, fill out this brief form, which will connect you to one of Ignatius' exceptional Book Fair Consultants!

‍
Post Summary: Ignatius Book Fairs offers a trustworthy alternative to schools seeking a kid-friendly Book Fair experience. While Scholastic and other national companies have dominated the Book Fair market for years, many schools are seeking an alternative they can trust. Ignatius Book Fairs, a collaboration between Ignatius Press and Ave Maria University, has made it their goal to provide teachers and schools with a curated selection of wholesome books for their students, without any questionable content.

Name: Ignatius Book Fairs: April Book of the Month Spotlight
Post Body:
Ignatius Book Fairs: Book of the Month for April

Discover Ignatius Book Fairs' Book of the Month: Will Wilder: The Relic of Perilous Falls. In the first installment of the series, readers meet Will Wilder, a headstrong 12-year-old with unique abilities. Young Will can see things that are invisible to everyone around him. Living in the town of Perilous Falls, he learns of a valuable relic hidden in the local church—the finger bone of St. Thomas the Apostle. Many in the town attribute miracles to the relic; however, after Will takes the centuries-old relic for his own use, odd things begin to happen.  

‍

“A relic is a key to unlock our faith” —Will Wilder: The Relic of Perilous Falls

‍

In the waters surrounding the town, ships begin to sink and dark creatures emerge, creatures only Will can see. To save his hometown from destruction, Will must confront these monsters and atone for the wrong he committed. This action-packed thriller captivates young readers and introduces them to noble heroes. Wilder’s adventures follow the ever-present fight between good and evil, teaching important lessons in virtue and courage. Author Raymond Arroyo gives readers an exciting fantasy series, writing with a much-needed Catholic twist.

‍

Check out the entire Will Wilder series at a Book Fair near you or shop online at shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com!
Post Summary: Discover Ignatius Book Fair’s Book of the Month for April: Will Wilder: The Relic of Perilous Falls!

Name: Ignatius Book Fairs: Benefiting Children and Schools
Post Body:
At schools across the country, Ignatius Book Fairs offer children the best titles in literature, from wholesome works to wholesome classics! In addition to students, Ignatius Book Fairs supports schools through the “Ave Dollars” rewards program. Now, every purchase at your school’s Ignatius Book Fair goes to directly benefit your school!

‍

Benefiting Your Children | Getting Wholesome Titles in the Hands of Your Children

How are our titles selected?

Every title offered by Ignatius Book Fairs has been carefully vetted to ensure that safe, wholesome content reaches the hands of your children. These books are filled with enriching stories that feature upstanding characters and role models. After these books have been successfully screened, they land on the shelves of our Fair, ready to inspire and deepen your child’s faith!

‍

‍

Benefiting Your School | Rewards for Each Book Purchased

How do “Ave Dollars” work?

With every purchase you make at an Ignatius Book Fair, your school earns Ave Dollars, a currency that can be used to purchase books or other classroom resources through Ignatius Book Fairs! These books can be used to grow your school, classroom, or parish library. Ave Dollars makes it possible for both your school and children to benefit from the Fair even after it has ended!

‍

Ignatius Book Fair Tip: Ave Dollars can also be redeemed for cash back for your school!

‍

Interested in our books? Make a visit to a Book Fair near you, or shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com to review our collection of wholesome and inspiring titles!

To host a book fair at your school, please fill out an inquiry form at ignatiusbookfairs.com!

‍
Post Summary: At schools across the country, Ignatius Book Fairs offer children the best titles in literature, from wholesome works to wholesome classics! In addition to students, Ignatius Book Fairs supports schools through the “Ave Dollars” rewards program

Name: Ignatius Book Fairs: Featured on The Drew Mariani Show!
Post Body:
Ignatius Book Fairs: Featured on The Drew Mariani Show!

In March, Ignatius Book Fairs was featured on Relevant Radio’s The Drew Mariani Show! During the first segment of his March 13 episode, Drew interviewed Mark Middendorf, President of Ave Maria University and founding member of Ignatius Book Fairs. The two discussed the mission of Ignatius Book Fairs and the future of book fairs across the country.

‍

A Scholastic Alternative | “Were Trying to Stand in the Breach”

Middendorf began by explaining the mission of Ignatius Book Fairs and identified the great need for virtuous literature in today’s world. He also spoke with Mariani about the trajectory of mainstream publishers, such as Scholastic, and the need for alternatives.

‍

“We’re trying to give an alternative that aligns our Catholic values from kindergarten through eighth grade that will really edify our children’s minds, shape their character, and deepen their faith” — Mark Middendorf

‍

Inside the Partnership | Ave Maria University and Ignatius Press

Mariani also asked Middendorf about the partnership between AMU and Ignatius Press. Middendorf explained, “We have about 600 titles, and every one of those titles is fully vetted,” to ensure that each child receives uplifting and virtuous content. These titles come from a wide array of publishers including Ignatius Press, Magnificat, Augustine Institute, and other orthodox Catholic publishers.  

‍

Middendorf praised the work of Fr. Joseph Fessio of Ignatius Press, who was also instrumental in the founding of Ignatius Book Fairs. Fessio worked “twelve hours a day” to ensure that the fairs got off to a great start. The collaboration between AMU and Ignatius Press has made it possible for Ignatius Book Fairs to thrive and expand to schools across the country.

‍

Founding the Fair | Consecrated to The Blessed Mother

Another reason why Ignatius Book Fairs has been so successful? Middendorf explained that the entire project was consecrated to Blessed Virgin Mary from the start.  

“We signed the partnership on September 8, on her birthday” —Mark Middendorf

Middendorf expressed certainty that God has blessed the fairs from the founding and knows that with God’s blessing, many bright days are ahead.

‍

The Future of Children’s Literature? | A Wholesome Horizon

Additionally, Middendorf commented on the future of children’s literature and expressed his belief that Ignatius Book Fairs would continue to help students gain “well-formed hearts and minds” for years to come. He also hinted at the future of Ignatius Book Fairs and its plan to author new literature specifically for the fairs!

‍

“You’re making a big, big difference, and we’re grateful for what you’re doing” —Drew Mariani

‍

Want to learn more about Ignatius Book Fairs? Check out our website, ignatiusbookfairs.com, and follow us on social media! Also, make sure to listen to the full segment of The Drew Mariani Show below:
Post Summary: In March, Ignatius Book Fairs was featured on Relevant Radio’s The Drew Mariani Show! During the first segment of his March 13th episode, Drew interviewed Mark Middendorf, President of Ave Maria University and founding member of Ignatius Book Fairs. The two discussed the mission of Ignatius Book Fairs and the future of Book Fairs across the country.

Name: Ignatius Book Fairs: Highlighting Key Catholic Authors and Timeless Christian Series
Post Body:
To get the best literature in the hands of your children, Ignatius Book Fairs features hundreds of beloved authors and cherished titles. Among these authors are notable Catholic writers who have used their skills to provide readers with faith-based literature. Additionally, Ignatius Book Fairs offers many timeless fictional series which have inspired thousands of readers over the years. Make sure to look out for these Catholic authors and classic book series at an Ignatius Book Fair near you!

‍

  1. The Chronicles of Narnia by C.S. Lewis | A Timeless Christian Series  

The Chronicles of Narnia series, penned by the esteemed C.S. Lewis, has been a staple on countless bookshelves, captivating young readers with enchanting tales of adventure and courage. Readers travel to the magical land of Narnia where they encounter numerous challenges and battles alongside the Pensive children. Each book features moral lessons and Christian truths, making them not only entertaining but also deeply impactful for readers of all ages. If you’re looking for a wholesome, Christian book series to read with your child, look no further than The Chronicles of Narnia! Visit your nearest Ignatius Book Fair or shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com to pick up this beloved series.  

‍

‍

  1. Fiorella de Maria | A Catholic Author with a Knack for Mystery  

Fiorella de Maria, a Catholic author renowned for her compelling mysteries, has penned numerous gripping tales, from her acclaimed Father Gabriel Mystery series to her wholesome historical work, A Most Dangerous Innocence. Blending faith and suspense, Fiorella’s popularity has risen in recent years as more readers discover her inspiring stories. In addition to her crime thrillers, de Maria has also written devout Catholic works detailing the lives of the saints. Of these, her most notable book explores the life of St. Maxamillian Kolbe, hero of the Holocaust. Fiorella de Maria primarily writes for young adult audiences, and her books can be found at Ignatius Book Fairs nationwide!  

Not able to attend one of our Book Fairs? Visit shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com to explore our vast collection of wholesome and Catholic literature!  

‍

‍

  1. J.R.R Tolkien | One of the Greatest Catholic Authors of All Time  

When discussing the greatest Catholic authors of all time, J.R.R Tolkien is sure to be in the top five. Perhaps trailing only St. Thomas Aquinas and St. Augustine, Tolkien’s descriptive style and Catholic themes make his works some of the most popular titles at the Book Fair! Tolkien’s fantasy novels, especially The Hobbit and The Lord of The Rings trilogy, have entertained and inspired readers for decades. Portraying the battle between good and evil, Tolkin not only captivates audiences with epic adventures but presents readers with Christian moral lessons. Pick up your collector's edition of the Lord of the Rings trilogy at the next Ignatius Book Fair!  

‍

‍

  1. Jean-Francois Kieffer | An Illustrator of Wholesome Children's Literature  

Jean-Francois Kieffer, a talented illustrator and author, has produced numerous children’s books, incorporating his devout faith into each of his works. In his most famous series, The Adventures of Loupio, Kieffer writes and illustrates the story of a young Christian traveler who learns lessons in courage and faith. Young Loupio, a 13th century orphan, meets St. Francis of Assisi and begins to live a life doing good for others. In the seven-book set, readers travel alongside Loupio learning wholesome lessons in Christian charity and virtue.  

‍

‍

  1. Anne of Green Gables by L.M. Montgomery | An Ignatius Book Fair Collectable Box Set!  

The Anne of Green Gables series, first published in 1908, is the model of wholesome storytelling and timeless values. The series follows the adventures of Anne Shirley, a spirited young orphan who learns important life lessons as she grows up on the farm of Green Gables. Anne's journeys, filled with imagination and friendship, reflect the Christian virtues most needed today. Whether exploring the picturesque landscapes of Avonlea or navigating the complexities of growing up, Anne's story is perfect for readers seeking narratives that are both uplifting and safe for children. The collectible four book set is available at Ignatius Book Fairs or online at shop.igantiusbookfairs.com.  

‍

To get your hands on these amazing reads, visit an Ignatius Book Fair or shop online at shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com.

‍
Post Summary: Ignatius Book Fair's vast library features notable Catholic authors who have used their skills to provide children with faith-based literature. Additionally, Ignatius Book Fairs offers many timeless fictional series which have inspired thousands of readers over the years. Make sure to look out for these Catholic authors and classic book series at the next Book Fair!

Name: Ignatius Book Fairs: May Book of the Month Spotlight
Post Body:
Mary Stories from the Bible- Magnificat and Ignatius Press

‍

For centuries, Catholics have designated May to be the month of Mary! This May, introduce your children to the beautiful Marian stories of the Gospels, presented in an easy-to-understand book.

‍

Accompanied with engaging illustrations, Mary Stories from the Bible follows five events from the Bible, including the Childhood of Mary, the Annunciation, the Birth of Jesus, the Wedding Feast at Cana, and the Death and Resurrection of Jesus. By looking at these biblical events through the eyes of Mary, children gain a deeper understanding of Mary's role in salvation history as well as her place as their spiritual mother!

‍

‍

Mary Stories from the Bible offers a compelling and accessible way for children to connect with the profound teachings of Scripture and the enduring legacy of Mary's faith and devotion. Take your children on an adventure through the Bible this May, pursuing Jesus through Mary!

‍
Post Summary: For centuries, Catholics have designated May to be the month of Mary! This May, introduce your children to the beautiful Marian stories of the Gospels, presented in an easy-to-understand book.

Name: Ignatius Book Fairs: Meet The Two Visionaries Behind the New Catholic Book Fair
Post Body:
In a world where countless titles and book fairs clamor for attention, Ignatius Book Fairs provides a sanctuary of virtue and faith. Ignatius Book Fairs is led by two Catholic visionaries who fight to provide enriching literature for families. These individuals are Mark Middendorf, President of Ave Maria University, and Fr. Joseph Fessio of Ignatius Press, whose partnership has provided numerous schools with a book fair that nourishes the mind, uplifts the spirit, and guides the soul along the path of faith.  

‍

A Book Fair Partnership Rooted in Faith

At the helm of Ave Maria University, Mark Middendorf’s leadership is guided by his Catholic ideals. As the President of AMU, Middendorf's vision extends beyond academia, championing literature that nurtures the soul and forms young minds in the truth. His dedication to fostering an environment where faith and education intertwine makes him a prominent figure in the world of Catholic literature. His partnership with Ignatius Book Fairs ensures that each title embodies the values cherished by Ave Maria University.

‍

“Through the partnership of the Book Fair, Ave Maria University and Ignatius Press are going to bring that same formation to students who will receive help in forming their intellects in the love of truth, their will in the love of God, and their hearts.” —AMU President Mark Middendorf

‍

‍

Fr. Joseph Fessio: The Catholic Priest Behind the Book Fair

Fr. Joseph Fessio, founder of Ignatius Press, has been a prominent figure in Catholic publishing since he founded Ignatius Press in 1978. With a steadfast commitment to upholding the teachings of the Catholic Church, Fr. Fessio has dedicated his life to curating a collection of books that inspire readers of all ages. His leadership ensures that each title featured at Ignatius Book Fairs reflects the highest standards of Christian virtue, making them not only safe for children but also enriching for families seeking wholesome entertainment.

Together, Middendorf and Fr. Fessio have provided wholesome literature to countless readers, each book being a testament to the richness of authentic Christianity. As families and educators seek safe and edifying content for their children, they can trust that each title at Ignatius Book Fairs provides their child with virtuous role models and wholesome stories.

‍

To get your hands on these amazing reads, visit an Ignatius Book Fair or shop online at shop.ignatiusbookfairs.com. May God Bless You!
Post Summary: In a world where countless titles and book fairs clamor for attention, Ignatius Book Fairs provides a sanctuary of virtue and faith. Ignatius Book Fairs features is led by two Catholic visionaries who fight to provide enriching literature for families. These individuals are Mark Middendorf, President of Ave Maria University and Fr. Joseph Fessio of Ignatius Press, whose partnership has provided numerous schools with a Book Fair that nourishes the mind, uplifts the spirit, and guides the soul along the path of faith.

Name: Ignatius Book Fairs: October Book of the Month Spotlight
Post Body:
The Joyful Beggar: October's Ignatius Book Fair Pick!

‍

Discover Ignatius Book Fairs' Book of the Month: The Joyful Beggar: A Novel About St. Francis of Assisi

‍

In this classic Catholic novel, Louis de Wohl uses his famed narrative skill to tell the story of a soldier and wealthy merchant's son who would become one of the most beloved Catholic saints.

‍

De Wohl's narrative begins in the late 12th century, capturing the vibrant atmosphere of Assisi, Italy. The author paints a detailed picture of Francis's early life as the son of a wealthy merchant, highlighting his youthful indulgences and eventual disillusionment with material wealth. This inner turmoil leads Francis to seek a deeper meaning to his life, prompting his radical choice to renounce his possessions and live among the poor.

‍

"The Joyful Beggar" stands as a testament to the enduring relevance of Francis's message, making it a compelling read for both the spiritually inclined and those interested in historical fiction. Make sure to purchase your copy of The Joyful Beggar at your next Ignatius Book Fair or at the Ignatius Book Fair online store!

‍

St Francis of Assisi, pray for us!

‍
Post Summary: In this Catholic novel, Louis de Wohl uses his famed narrative skill to tell the story of a soldier and wealthy merchant's son who would become St. Francis of Assisi.

Name: Ignatius Book Fairs: September Book of the Month Spotlight
Post Body:
Catechism of the Seven Sacraments: Catholic Sacraments For Kids!

‍

‍

Discover Ignatius Book Fairs' Book of the Month: Catechism of the Seven Sacraments! This book explores the seven sacraments of the Catholic Church and explains them in a way that children can grasp. Your child will enjoy the way authors Kevin and Mary O'Neill use Legos to tell the story of Christ’s love for his Church! In explaining the biblical roots of the seven sacraments, this book takes children on an engaging adventure through salvation history, highlighting the many covenants God makes with his people.  

‍

‍

‍

This book is a perfect gift for children making their First Reconciliation or First Holy Communion! Using Pope Benedict XVI's "covenant theology" The Catechism of the Seven Sacraments teaches children how Christ fulfills the Old Testament through the sacramental life of the Church. Make sure to look for a copy at an Ignatius Book Fair near you!

‍

Want to bring an Ignatius Book Fair to your school? Fill out an Inquiry Form today!

‍
Post Summary: Discover Ignatius Book Fairs' Book of the Month: Catechism of the Seven Sacraments!

Name: Ignatius Book Fairs: Take Home a Wholesome Classic!
Post Body:
A World Full of Dickens Stories: Fall in Love with Ignatius Book Fair’s Book of the Month

‍

This November, Ignatius Book Fairs is celebrating A World Full of Dickens Stories as November’s Book of the Month, offering a perfect opportunity to introduce young readers to timeless tales of Christian values, redemption, and moral virtue. With vivid characters and powerful plots, Dickens' stories continue to resonate across generations, making them a staff favorite at the book fair.

‍

The Timeless Appeal of Dickens

Charles Dickens’ works like A Christmas Carol and Oliver Twist teach lessons of kindness, generosity, and the transformative power of love. His stories, rich with themes of redemption and self-improvement offer parents a wholesome way to engage young minds with important moral lessons. Whether it's the compassion of Scrooge or the resilience of Oliver, Dickens' characters exemplify values that align with our beautiful faith.

‍

Perfect for Young Readers

Dickens’ books are a wonderful choice for parents and educators looking for alternative literature that supports Christian values. Stories such as Great Expectations and David Copperfield not only entertain but also teach the importance of integrity, kindness, and forgiveness.

‍

Dickens at Ignatius Book Fairs

This edition, handpicked by our staff, is perfect for introducing children to the moral lessons of Dickens while encouraging a love of reading that will continue for a lifetime. As a staff favorite, Dickens’ stories remain a beloved choice for families looking to enrich their reading experience with meaningful, faith-filled literature.

This November, discover the world of Dickens stories at Ignatius Book Fair—where quality literature and Catholic values come together. Whether you're looking for wholesome books for children or seeking meaningful titles to enrich your family’s collection, A World Full of Dickens Stories is an excellent choice. Visit the book fair today and bring home these stories of hope, redemption, and faith!

‍
Post Summary: This November, Ignatius Book Fairs is celebrating A World Full of Dickens Stories as November’s Book of the Month, offering a perfect opportunity to introduce young readers to timeless tales of Christian values, redemption, and moral virtue.

Name: Lent
Post Body:
Pray

Increase Family Prayer

9

Dfkasjdfioajsdofijasdoif

Fast as a Family

Meatless Family Meals 🍽️

Go beyond just Fridays and try a simple, meatless meal together more often.

Give Up Screen Time One Day a Week 📵

Replace TV and social media with family prayer or service.

Fast from Complaining 🚫

Make an effort to replace complaints with gratitude.

Simple Living Challenge 🌿

Eat simpler meals and donate the money saved to a food pantry or charity.

No-Snacking Days 🍏

Choose a day to fast between meals as a family.

Give Up a Favorite Treat Together 🍫

Encourage each other to make a meaningful sacrifice.

Fasting from Waste ♻️

Use Lent to be mindful of wastefulness and practice gratitude for resources.

Silence Challenge 🤫

Dedicate a time for quiet, no distractions, to listen to God—perhaps one night a week or Saturday mornings as a family.

Giving and Service

Family Donation Drive 🎁

Declutter and donate clothes, books, or toys to a charity.

Make "Blessing Bags" ❤️

Fill bags with snacks, hygiene products, and a prayer card to give to the homeless.

Support a Mission or Charity 🤲

Choose a Catholic organization to give to as a family.

Visit the Elderly or Sick🏡💐

Call or visit a relative or neighbor who may be lonely.

Write Letters to Priests & Religious ✝️

Send notes of encouragement and thanks.

Make a "Love Jar" 💌

Write kind notes for each other to read throughout Lent. Write a small encouragement or love note to a family member each day of lent.

Cook a Meal for Someone in Need 🍲

Deliver a meal to a new mom, sick friend, or grieving family.

Thinking Ahead easter ideas:

Resurrection Garden 🌱

Create a mini garden representing Jesus' tomb using a small pot, soil, moss, and a stone for the entrance. This is a great way to illustrate the Resurrection story.

Story of the Cross Sticker Book 🎨

Use this activity book to fill in numbered stickers and create beautiful  masterpieces that tell the story of the cross up to the Ressurection.

Paschal Candle Craft 🕯️

Children can decorate a white candle with religious symbols (like a cross, alpha & omega, and the current year) using paint, stickers, or melted wax. Light it during Easter dinner or prayer time.

Resurrection Eggs 🥚

Fill 12 plastic eggs with small objects representing parts of the Passion (e.g., a piece of palm, a thorn, a nail, a stone, a small cross). Open them one by one to tell the Easter story.

Easter Story Bracelet 📿

Make a bracelet with different colored beads, each representing a part of Holy Week (e.g., purple for Palm Sunday, red for Good Friday, white for the Resurrection).

Handprint Easter Lamb 🐑

Use white paint to create a child’s handprint on black paper. Add googly eyes and a drawn smile to make a fluffy lamb, symbolizing Jesus as the Lamb of God.

Empty Tomb Craft ⛰️

Use a paper plate, construction paper, or clay to create an "empty tomb" scene with the stone rolled away. Kids can act out the Resurrection story with their craft.

Stained Glass Cross ✝️

Make a cross with black construction paper and fill the inside with tissue paper pieces in bright colors to resemble a stained-glass window. Hang it in a sunny window.

He Is Risen Banner 🎨

Let kids decorate a large banner with “He Is Risen” using paint, fabric, or markers. They can add flowers, doves, or other Easter symbols.

‍
Post Summary: Enjoy these family friendly recommendations to make the most out of Lent!

Name: What Makes Ignatius Book Fairs a Safe Choice for Parents?
Post Body:
Ignatius Book Fairs was established to aid families in their search for truthful and virtuous children’s literature! Every Ignatius Book Fair offers a plethora of faithful and wholesome stories centered around beauty, virtue, and goodness. Here are three reasons why Ignatius Book Fairs are a safe choice for parents:

  1. Each Fair Features Curated and Wholesome Content

Ignatius Book Fairs is dedicated to providing wholesome content for Christian families. Because of this, each title offered at an Ignatius Book Fair is specifically curated to accomplish this mission! Every book has been intentionally chosen to encourage virtue and faithfulness, while also giving children quality entertainment. Ignatius Book Fairs, by combining exceptional content with authentic Catholic faith, provides parents with literature they can trust!

  1. Each Story Supports Catholic Values

At many mainstream book fairs, children’s content is guided and shaped by modern culture. However, at Ignatius Book Fairs, all literature is grounded in the rich truth of the Catholic faith and the tradition of Christ’s Church. Although the world rejects traditional beliefs and family values, Ignatius Book Fairs continues to offer books that proclaim the truth rooted in Christ.

“That’s our promise to parents, that anything that you find at an Ignatius Book Fair will be something that you can trust” —Rose Trabbic, IBF Director of Operations
  1. Tools to Enhance Catholic Family Life

Ignatius Book Fairs features numerous books for families hoping to integrate the faith into their everyday life! As The Catechism of the Catholic Church states, the family is a “domestic church” and it needs wholesome entertainment that enriches the goodness of the home. While adhering to the Church’s teachings, Ignatius Book Fairs intentionally aims to build up Catholic family life.

Parents striving to raise virtuous children deserve content they can trust! Ignatius Book Fairs is committed to offering books that won’t contradict the Christian faith, nor the importance of the family. Ultimately, Ignatius Book Fairs provides a sanctuary for Catholics seeking a nourishing, enriching, and wholesome environment to support their children through the power of literature.
Post Summary: Ignatius Book Fairs was established to aid Catholic families in search of truthful and virtuous children’s literature. Ignatius Book Fairs offer a faith-filled solution, featuring wholesome stories centered around beauty, virtue and goodness. Here are three reasons why Ignatius Book Fairs are a safe choice for Catholic parents!
